intro: Microgonium craspedoneurum, commonly known as the spiky liverwort, is a small, aquatic plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its intricate thalloid structure, which consists of a leaf-like, flattened body covered in tiny, spiky projections called rhizoids. This plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and wetlands. Its reproductive structures, including the gametophytes and sporophytes, are well-developed and play a key role in its life cycle. Microgonium craspedoneurum is an important indicator species for water quality due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
